name: Hotel Magenta Paris

reviews.text: Recently stayed for 2 nights at Hotel Magenta. From the outside it looks nice, step inside and you are greated by friendly staff and a lovely interier. We had a tripple room which had lots of space. 5 minute walk to Gard de L'est and around 15 minutes to Gard de Nord.
reviews.title: Totally recomended

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and our bedroom was at the back of the hotel meaning it was lovely and quiet. Breakfast was fairly basic but what you would expect for the price range of the hotel. The food was lovely and you could help yourself. Staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Small rooms, clean, hot water, great breakfast

reviews.text: One point to note about the area - If you like Indian food you will be spoilt for choice. I do not enjoy Indian food and to top it off I am a vegetarian so did have to search hard for a resturant. A lot of Japanes resturants and kabab bars around also.
reviews.title: Fantastic all round

reviews.text: This is a really late review, I've been meaning to write a testimonial of sorts for ages.
reviews.title: Decent value but ask for an interior room
great last minute find
reviews.text: We recently spent 2 weeks in France and spent our last two nights at Hotel Magenta. We booked very last minute as we were unsure of where our travels would lead us. We found the hotel on Expedia and checked it out on Trip Advisor before we booked. The room was perfect, small but clean and adequate. We got a very reduced rate and our room was upgraded when we arrived. The breakfast buffet was unbelievable with a large selection of breads, cereal, yogurt, fruit, eggs and meats as well as juice, tea and coffee. The front desk was helpful and advised us how to easily get to the airport using puiblic transportation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is close to Gare d'est and Gare Nord as well as close to a metro stop. There are several good Bistro in the area. We highly recommend this little hotel.
reviews.title: Overall excellent value for money, very few complaints, definately would stay again.

reviews.text: First thing you notice when visiting this hotel is the very helpful staff who speak perfect English and always go out of their way to help the customer.
reviews.title: A comfortable, clean, air conditioned stay in down town Paris. Excellent!

reviews.text: The hotel rooms are a bit on the small side but no more than any other 3-star hotel I've stayed at. I wouldn't say I felt trapped or unable to move. The main purpose of my stay was not to live in the hotel, so it was more than adequate.
reviews.title: Located near a metro stop (Jacques Besergent?) and Gard du Nord and Gard de Est

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're interested in booking this hotel and you're a light sleeper, either take some ear-plugs with you or ask for a room that doesn't face the boulevard de magenta as I think it is one of the busiest streets in Paris and hardly any night passed without an ambulance running its siren through.
reviews.title: Convinient, relaxed and totally chilled out Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i thought this was a budget boutique hotel, but it isn't. the pictures (and the color / interior design of the lobby) can be misleading. it is basically a basic hotel, with basic rooms, basic breakfast. But it is clean, quiet and with friendly stuff. My opinion is that is a bit expensive for what it is.
reviews.title: It looks better in the pictures

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst the Magenta would have been OK for under a hundred euros, we paid over double that as we had to book last minute. It was definitely not a 250 euro a night hotel by any stretch of the imaginiation - paris or not.
reviews.title: Costs at least twice as much as it should and serves a terrible breakfast

reviews.text: The cleanliness of the room was OK, the location was fairly handy for the train station but a bit grotty. Bed was uncomfortable and pillows didn't seem all that fresh. Breakfast was absolutely dreadful. Walls are paper thin and you can clearly hear locations in the room nextdoor. We booked with Lastminute and were apparently allocated a premium room, I asked the reception what this actually gave us and the answer was 'a bit more space' but it was still tight even by Paris standards.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, nice location, don't rely on the website's pictures

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hote, nice staff. Location is ok, very close to the subway, but far from the center of the city. We had booked a premium room, and on the picture, it looked spacious. But it was not in the least, even for european standard... The main downside: no AC. At all. During the whole week. We asked them about it, said that it was the whole hotel that had no AC and that somebody was supposed to come and turn it on, but it was never done. We had to sleep with the window open, and our room was on the side of the street. I have no problem sleeping with all the noise from the street, but my mother slept very badly. Anyway, it was clean, we had a really nice view from our room. We had a deal with the flight company, so it was a good value, but I think the price they usually charge is overated.
reviews.title: Nice, comfortable rooms. Nice staff, nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, especially if you want to get away from the more touristed areas. Great breakfast, great internet access, nice staff. Would use this hotel again. Metro stop just in front and left,
reviews.title: Very purple, comfortable, and nicely located

reviews.text: I booked my trip on Lastminute.com and have never been to Paris before (let alone travelled anywhere by myself before!). The hotel is actually only about a 15min walk from Gare de Nord station, it was daunting stepping out of the station into the unknown as the area is just like Oxford Street and I did go wrong a few times but my best advice is dont be afraid TO ASK people - I asked plenty and received a friendly reception! Hotel Magenta is in the heart of the bustling area but once inside, you could not hear a thing outside. Modern, spotless, friendly, safe (which was really important for me travelling alone - 24 hour reception staff and surveillance) central location - everything you could possibly ask for from a hotel. If you have found a deal that includes this hotel and Eurostar then go for it! To stay at the hotel independantly you will pay an awful lot more and I was shocked at the rates for one night so I was over the moon that not only was it perfect but I got a bargain too!! 100% recommend this hotel. Enjoy your trip!
reviews.title: Could not have picked a better hotel if I'd tried!

reviews.text: The hotel gives you good value for your money: very easy hifi Internet connection in room, plenty of space in room, quiet, good breakfast,good location.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close to the metro, where in a previous hotel I still had to walk a few kilometers under ground, here you descend the stairs and you're in the metro.
reviews.title: Great Time During Our 30th + Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early at the hotel but we were informed that they can keep our luggage safely until the required check in time. Staffs incl. the housekeepers were very courteous and friendly (always had smile on their faces, makes us feel very welcome). Room for couple is just enough since we only need it for sleeping. All day till midnight we were out exploring the city. Very good location, accessible to nearby stores and walking distance to most tourist spots, 10-45 mins walk. Breakfast was the best we ever had and good choices even for weight watcher. Will definitely choose this hotel next time we go back to Paris. We've been recommending this hotel to our friends for cost and accessibilitity
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, excellent location
Good Basic Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed in Hotel Magenta for 5 nights in February 2010.

description: Totally renovated at the end of 2008, 100% non smoking, the HotelMagentaParis.com, housed in an elegant 19th century building, offers 65 rooms decorated in a stylish modern design, with adjoining private bathrooms, hair-dryer, magnifying mirror and WC. Dedicated to the clients’ well being, all the rooms are equipped with air conditioning, double-glazed windows, mini-bar, cable TV offering over 28 channels and 6 languages, laptop safe, free wifi, direct telephone line for incoming & outgoing calls and complimentary tea & coffee amenity tray. The buffet-breakfast is served from 7am to 10am in the breakfast room.
